SENT.plain: Recent data strongly suggest that "antiphospholipid" autoantibodies are directed against a variety of phospholipid-binding plasma proteins including beta 2GPI, prothrombin, factor Xa, protein C, and protein S
Further characterization of the spectrum of antibody specificity and affinity in individual patients may explain the varied clinical presentations associated with aPLs
The next several years hold great promise for a better understanding of the pathophysiology of the aPL syndrome and the precise role of aPLs in the pathogenesis of thrombosis and recurrent fetal loss
